text: The 1948–49 season was the inaugural season of A group under the name Republican Football Division (). Cherno More started the season as TVP but was renamed after the first round to Botev pri DNV (),https://bulgarian- football.com/archive/1948-1949/republikanska-divizia.html a common practice in the years after the establishment of the People's Republic of Bulgaria. Botev is 19th-century Bulgarian revolutionary and poet Hristo Botev and pri DNV stands for Home of the People's Army (). ==Republican Football Division== === Matches=== http://www.retro-football.bg/?q=bg/1948-49 ===League standings=== ===Results summary=== ===Goalscorers=== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" |- !Rank !Scorer !Goals |- |rowspan="1"|1 |align="left"| Nedko Nedev |rowspan="1"|11 |- |rowspan="1"|2 |align="left"| Hristo Konakov |rowspan="1"|6 |- |rowspan="1"|3 |align="left"| Georgi Radev |rowspan="1"|4 |- |rowspan="1"|4 |align="left"| Borislav Kovachev |rowspan="1"|3 |- |rowspan="1"|5 |align="left"| Todor Terzistoev |rowspan="1"|2 |- |rowspan="4"|6 |align="left"| Mladen Dzhurov |rowspan="4"|1 |- |align="left"| Nikola Ganchev |- |- |align="left"| Asen Petrov |- |- |align="left"| Dimitar Stefanov |- |} ==Bulgarian Cup== *Torpedo Pernik is a former name of Minyor Pernik == References == Category:PFC Cherno More Varna seasons Cherno More Varna
title: 1948–49 PFC Cherno More Varna season
